In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

You can use the built-in `lowercase` function in Julia to convert a string into lower case. Then you can replace all non-alphanumeric characters (except for underscores) with underscores using a regular expression. Here is how you can do it:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    # Lowercase the column name
    col = lowercase(col)
    
    # Replace spaces and hyphens with an underscore
    col = replace(col, r"[ _-]+", "_")

    return col
end
```

You can use this function like so:

```julia
column_name = "My Column"
cleaned_column = clean_column(column_name)
println(cleaned_column)  # Outputs: my_column
```
